The trial protocol specified ONC201 oral loading dose of 625 mg administered twice weekly (Monday and Thursday) and panobinostat oral dose of 20 mg taken three times weekly (Monday, Wednesday, Friday) for a 28‑day cycle, repeated until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Interim analysis of the trial reported a median overall survival (OS) of 15 months for patients with H3K27M‑mutant DIPG receiving this regimen, compared with the historical median OS of 9 months for standard radiation alone. Moreover, a subgroup analysis showed that patients harboring an ACVR1 mutation experienced a 20% higher radiographic response rate (partial response) than those without the mutation, without an increase in grade ≥ 3 adverse events. The most common toxicities were mild fatigue, transient nausea, and grade 1–2 thrombocytopenia. The patient tolerated the regimen well, with no dose reductions required after the first two cycles.
